Instruction: Place a sheet of waxed paper on a flat work surface.

Heat butter in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring frequently. Slowly pour maple syrup into the saucepan while stirring with the butter; bring to a gentle simmer. Add confectioners' sugar, cinnamon, and salt to the syrup mixture, stirring with a whisk; cook and stir until the mixture is warmed and the confectioners' sugar is fully dissolved. Gently mix walnuts into the liquid until coated and remove the saucepan from the heat. Let the mixture cool slightly.
Allow the walnut mixture to cool slightly before spooning dollops onto the waxed paper, letting them spread into rounded mounds; cool completely for at least 30 minutes until set.
To achieve a firmer consistency for the pralines, elevate the heat to induce a soft boil until the mixture's temperature reaches 235 degrees F (113 degrees C).
